artifact_metadata.description: Library of quirky sign-offs, market heuristics, and behavioral finance quotes for the Market Mayhem newsletter.
artifact_metadata.author: Adam v23.5 Cognitive Architect

items.annotation: The ultimate power move; implies you didn't even read it, just saw it was wrong
Implies 'I am important enough to be out of the office but dedicated enough to reply'

items.text: May the Alpha be with you.
To infinity and beyond (or until the next earnings call),
The trend is your friend (until the bend at the end).
items.meaning: Don't fight the dominant market direction, but watch for reversals
Don't buy an asset that is crashing; wait for it to stabilize

items.text: Buy the rumor, sell the news.
items.meaning: Markets price in events before they happen; the actual event is often a liquidity exit
Even a dead cat will bounce if dropped from high enough; a small recovery in a massive crash doesn't mean the bottom is in
Liquidity provided by the Federal Reserve overpowers most fundamental analysis

items.text: Price is what you pay, value is what you get.
items.meaning: Price acts as a voting machine in the short run, a weighing machine in the long run
Divide 72 by the annual rate of return to see how many years it takes to double your money

items.text: Markets take the stairs up and the elevator down.
items.meaning: Bull markets are slow and steady; crashes are sudden and violent
In times of crisis, liquidity is the most valuable asset

items.text: Be fearful when others are greedy, and greedy when others are fearful.
When the shoeshine boy gives you stock tips, it's time to sell.
items.meaning: The Kennedy heuristic for identifying market tops

items.text: Sell in May and go away.
items.meaning: Historical underperformance of stocks during summer months

items.text: The market can remain irrational longer than you can remain solvent.
items.author: John Maynard Keynes

items.text: The investor’s chief problem – and even his worst enemy – is likely to be himself.
items.author: Benjamin Graham

items.text: Nothing in life is quite as important as you think it is while you are thinking about it.
items.author: Daniel Kahneman (Focusing Illusion)

items.text: History never repeats itself; man always does.
items.author: Voltaire / Mogsel (adapted for finance)

items.text: It's not whether you're right or wrong that's important, but how much money you make when you're right and how much you lose when you're wrong.
items.author: George Soros

items.text: Risk comes from not knowing what you are doing.
items.author: Warren Buffett

items.text: Luck and risk are siblings. They are both the reality that every outcome in life is guided by forces other than individual effort.
items.author: Morgan Housel

items.text: The four most dangerous words in investing are: 'this time it's different.'
items.author: Sir John Templeton

items.text: The stock market is a device for transferring money from the impatient to the patient.
items.author: Warren Buffett

items.text: In investing, what is comfortable is rarely profitable.
items.author: Robert Arnott

items.text: A lot of people with high IQs are terrible investors because they have terrible temperaments.
items.author: Charlie Munger
